unnormalised: Picture this: You're browsing your favourite online shop, maybe for that perfect Anarkali suit from Fabindia or a snazzy new cricket bat after watching Kohli smash sixes. You carefully add everything to your cart – the size is right, the colour is stunning, the bat promises Kapil Dev-esque power! You even fill in your address (Sector 17, Chandigarh, naturally). Then… crickets. You vanish. Your cart sits there, lonely and forgotten, like a stray cow in a Delhi roundabout.

unnormalised: Sound familiar, Rajesh? This, my friend, is the dreaded phenomenon known as cart abandonment. And it’s as common as finding chai stalls on every corner of Mumbai. According to some stats, around 70% of shoppers ditch their carts before hitting that sweet, sweet "Place Order" button. 70%! That's more than the number of times SRK said "Rahul" in Kuch Kuch Hota Hai!

unnormalised: Why? Oh, the reasons are as varied as the spices in your mom's biryani. Maybe shipping costs popped up like surprise guests at a wedding (Rs. 250 for delivery? Seriously?!). Maybe the checkout process was more complicated than understanding an IIT professor’s lecture on quantum physics. Or perhaps, you simply got distracted by that phone call from Chacha Ji, reminding you about the upcoming Diwali puja.

unnormalised: Retailers are desperately trying to woo those abandoned carts back. They’re sending reminder emails, offering discounts, even resorting to dramatic subject lines like "Your Shopping Cart is Crying Tears of Masala Chai!" But honestly, sometimes, a little nudge is all it takes.

unnormalised: So, the next time you find yourself abandoning a cart, ask yourself: Are you really ready to let that fabulous kurta get away? Don't let your virtual shopping basket become another incomplete chapter in your life story. Finish the transaction! Your wardrobe (and your wallet, maybe) will thank you for it. And who knows, maybe you’ll even feel a little less like Rahul, wandering lost in a summer camp.
